Headline_News: Turkish, Indonesian firms strike defense cooperation deals
Description_News: Two Turkish defense companies setup separate cooperation deals with their Indonesian counterparts at the 2022 Indo Defense and Expo in Jakarta on Thursday, further strengthening existing industrial ties.

Headline_News: Twitter starts rolling out new paid subscription
Description_News: Days into the Tesla boss's stewardship of one of the world's leading platforms for discourse and activism, his promises and provocations are prompting a wave of reactions -- including warnings from the United Nations and an apology from Twitter's co-founder.

Headline_News: Waste reduction and circular-economy acceleration to fight against marine debris
Description_News: According to the World Bank, Indonesia generates approximately 7.8 million tonnes of plastic waste annually.

Headline_News: Thales Indonesia: Delivering digital solutions 40 years and beyond
Description_News: Indonesia is rising to international prominence due to its increasing participation in various intergovernmental forums, including ASEAN and the Group of 20.

Headline_News: Aston Martin losses deepen despite rising car sales
Description_News: Losses after tax hit £228 million ($262 million) in the three months to the end of September, after a shortfall of almost £90 million a year earlier, according to the group which is targeting electrification of its range.

Headline_News: Inspirational traditional business owners lift up their communities
Description_News: Micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) are the backbone of Indonesia’s economy, accounting for over 61 percent of Indonesia’s total gross domestic product (GDP).

Headline_News: Twitter confirms layoffs to begin Friday as Elon Musk steps in
Description_News: Twitter said it will start laying off employees on Friday, as the new billionaire owner Elon Musk moves quickly after his big takeover to make the messaging platform financially sound.

Headline_News: BMW sees profits jump on higher prices for luxury cars
Description_News: The Munich-based group said it had booked a net profit of nearly 3.2 billion euros ($3.1 billion), up from 2.6 billion euros between July and September last year.

Headline_News: Europe leans on Asia for 'homegrown' EV batteries
Description_News: Europe's drive to build a homegrown electric vehicle battery industry is hitting roadblocks as investors shy away from giving start-ups sufficient funding to challenge the Asian companies that dominate the market.

Headline_News: Executive column: Local opportunities outweigh global risks, HP says
Description_News: HP Greater Asia vice president and head of personal systems Kong Meng Koh spoke to The Jakarta Post’s Divya Karyza about the IT company’s take on Indonesia’s growing cyberthreats and the country’s technology landscape, while also discussing HP’s strategy in dealing with global economic uncertainty.

Headline_News: Bukalapak scores 86 percent jump in Q3 revenue
Description_News: Bukalapak has turned in yet another positive performance this year as the company managed to grow its year-on-year (yoy) revenue by 86 percent as of the third quarter, as announced in a press statement about the company’s financial report released on Sunday.

Headline_News: BP quarterly profit surges on high energy prices
Description_News: Replacement cost profit soared to $8.2 billion in the three months to September, the British energy major announced.

Headline_News: Toyota first-half net profit sags 23% on rising costs
Description_News: Operating profit dropped 34.7 percent to 1.14 trillion yen in the April-September period on sales of 17.7 trillion yen, up 14.4 percent.

Headline_News: Saudi Aramco posts 39 percent jump in profits
Description_News: The announcement came as the OPEC+ cartel of oil producers was set to implement production cuts that have drawn the ire of the United States, which says the move -- approved at a meeting last month -- amounts to "aligning with Russia" in the conflict.

Headline_News: Santini expands orchid cultivation with Colombian firm
Description_News: Orchid plantation firm PT Santini Mitra Amanah (SMA) has signed a technical assistance agreement on orchid cultivation with Colombia-based Alma Del Bosque following talks that began in July.

Headline_News: JICT welcomes Alexander Von Humboldt, largest-ever container ship to call at Indonesia
Description_News: The Jakarta International Container Terminal (JICT) welcomed on Monday the largest container ship ever to call at the port as part of a weekly direct shipping service connecting Indonesia with the United States.

Headline_News: Beat Market Expectation, IOH Continue Strong Growth in Q3 2022
Description_News: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison (IOH) has shown significant growth this year, based on its solid growth in total revenue and net profits in the third quarter.

Headline_News: Toyota's quarterly output up 30%, but parts shortages continue
Description_News: Toyota Motor Corp on Friday said global production climbed 30 percent in the quarter ended in September, but warned the shortages of semiconductors and other parts that have roiled the auto industry would still constrain output in coming months.

Headline_News: Elon Musk's Twitter ownership starts with firings, uncertainty
Description_News: The CEO of electric car maker Tesla Inc has said he wants to "defeat" spam bots on Twitter, make the algorithms that determine how content is presented to its users publicly available, and prevent the platform from becoming an echo chamber for hate and division, even as he limits censorship.

Headline_News: Big RI banks look to further growth despite global tempest
Description_News: Major Indonesian banks expect 2023 to be a challenging year given the global risks of inflation, recession and foreign exchange volatility, yet they look to continued expansion, emboldened by strong third-quarter reports and a resilient domestic economy.

Headline_News: Meta's quarterly profit more than halved to $4.4 billion
Description_News: The social networking giant, which faces stagnating user numbers and cuts in advertising budgets, also said revenue slipped to $27.7 billion from $29 billion a year earlier.

Headline_News: Samsung Electronics says Q3 operating profit down 31% on-year
Description_News: Earnings in its crucial memory chips division were down, the company said in a statement, adding that "demand for consumer products remained weak".

Headline_News: Credit Suisse to pay 238 million euros to settle French fraud probe
Description_News: The settlement will see Switzerland's second-largest bank pay a fine of 123 million euros and pay an additional 115 million euros in damages and interest to the French state.

Headline_News: Executive column: Rolls Royce pitches SMR, vertical-takeoff aircraft for Indonesian backlands
Description_News: Bicky Bhangu, president of South East Asia, Pacific and South Korea Rolls-Royce spoke with The Jakarta Post to discuss solutions to tackle the net-zero target in the airline industry and current challenges that Indonesia is facing.

Headline_News: Indonesia left behind in biotech, HigherHeight aims at human resources
Description_News: Biotechnology is looking to surpass the shares of chemically derived drugs and dominate the global pharmaceutical industry by 52 percent in 2027, according to data from the International Pharmaceutical Manufacturers Group (IPMG).

Headline_News: BCA to keep lending rate unchanged as corporate-loan growth slows
Description_News: The country’s largest private lender has vowed to keep credit interest rates unchanged, affording borrowers some breathing room despite multiple rate hikes by the central bank.

Headline_News: Executive Column: The fittest survive economic turbulence, says Pluang
Description_News: Pluang cofounder Claudia Kolonas spoke to The Jakarta Post’s Deni Ghifari on Oct. 17 about how the start-up aims to be a part of Indonesia's effort to increase financial literacy and how it is handling the global macroeconomic turbulence.
